page.title: 12 THE CHURCH OF ST. ANDREW
page.content: Saint Andrew's Church has served the Spiritual needs of the community for nearly 800 years. It was mentioned in the Domesday Survey of 1086, but of the original building nothing remains. The present building dates from the mid 13th.Century. Considerable recon- struction took place during the 14th. and 15th.Centuries, the Vestry being added in 1526. The Church was completely restored during 1866. To preserve this much loved building the Church Council - aided by a 40% grant from the Dept.of the Environment - has now an ongoing plan of restoration. As well as regular Communion and Family Services at St. Andrew's, our Vicar, Rev. Peter Taylor, has encouraged ecumenical evening worship in homes since the recent closure of the Baptist Chapel.
